choices.D: Apply a Group Policy setting that blocks the cleanup of unused language packs
choices.C: Apply a Group Policy setting to disable the Time & language settings
choices.B: Assign a default time zone on each host
choices.A: Configure the international settings on each host

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop host pool.
You add a French language pack to each session host in the host pool.
Several days later, users report that English displays when they connect to Azure Virtual Desktop.
After an investigation, you discover that the French language pack was removed, and the session hosts reverted to English.
You need to ensure that the French language pack is always available on the session hosts.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To ensure that the French language pack is always available on the session hosts, you should apply a Group Policy setting that blocks the cleanup of unused language packs (Option D). This prevents the system from automatically removing the language pack when it is not in use.

Selected Answer: D
D. Apply a Group Policy setting that blocks the cleanup of unused language packs

To ensure that your host machines maintain Windows activation, you need to configure the following outbound URL and port:

URL: kms.core.windows.net or azkms.core.windows.net
Port: 1688 (TCP)
These settings allow your Azure Virtual Desktop session hosts to connect to the Azure Key Management Service (KMS) for Windows activation.

Answers are correct: 
kms.core.windows.net 1688 Windows activation Internet

Answer should be B .. Hybrid AD is needed.

Selected Answer: B
To ensure that you can use Microsoft Endpoint Manager to manage security updates on the session hosts, you should configure the session hosts as hybrid Azure AD-joined (Option B). This allows the session hosts to be managed by both your on-premises Active Directory and Azure AD, enabling integration with Microsoft Endpoint Manager for managing updates and other policies.

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an on-premises Active Directory domain named contoso.com that syncs to an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant.
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop host pool named Pool1 that has the following settings:
✑ Host pool name: Pool1
✑ Host pool type: Personal
✑ Load balancing algorithm: Breadth-first

Number of VMs: 3 -
//IMG//

The session hosts have the following configurations:
✑ Image used to create the virtual machines: Windows 10 Enterprise
✑ Virtual machines domain-joined to: On-premises contoso.com domain
You need to ensure that you can use Microsoft EndPoint Manager to manage security update on the session hosts.
What should you do?

discussion.content: Service updates happen monthly. If there are major issues, critical updates will be provided at a more frequent pace.

Service updates happen monthly.
